metadata.title: USN-6089-1 -- Linux kernel (OEM) vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that the Intel i915 graphics driver in the Linux kernel did not perform a GPU TLB flush in some situations. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6089-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  linux-buildinfo-6.0.0-1016-oem - 6.0.0-1016.16 linux-modules-ipu6-6.0.0-1016-oem - 6.0.0-1016.16 linux-tools-6.0.0-1016-oem - 6.0.0-1016.16 linux-image-unsigned-6.0.0-1016-oem - 6.0.0-1016.16 linux-oem-6.0-tools-host - 6.0.0-1016.16 linux-modules-6.0.0-1016-oem - 6.0.0-1016.16 linux-modules-iwlwifi-6.0.0-1016-oem - 6.0.0-1016.16 linux-oem-6.0-tools-6.0.0-1016 - 6.0.0-1016.16 linux-oem-6.0-headers-6.0.0-1016 - 6.0.0-1016.16 linux-modules-ivsc-6.0.0-1016-oem - 6.0.0-1016.16 linux-headers-6.0.0-1016-oem - 6.0.0-1016.16 linux-image-6.0.0-1016-oem - 6.0.0-1016.16 No subscription required  linux-modules-ipu6-oem-22.04b - 6.0.0.1016.16 linux-headers-oem-22.04b - 6.0.0.1016.16 linux-image-oem-22.04b - 6.0.0.1016.16 linux-modules-ivsc-oem-22.04b - 6.0.0.1016.16 linux-modules-iwlwifi-oem-22.04b - 6.0.0.1016.16 linux-oem-22.04b - 6.0.0.1016.16 linux-tools-oem-22.04b - 6.0.0.1016.16 No subscription required
